questions.question: What is the primary function of Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Microsoft Word is primarily used for creating documents such as letters, reports, and essays.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the formula bar in Microsoft Excel?
questions.feedback: The formula bar in Excel is used to enter or edit data, including formulas, in the active cell.

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using templates in Microsoft PowerPoint?
questions.feedback: Templates in PowerPoint help users to quickly create presentations with predefined styles and layouts.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to save a document in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + S is the shortcut key to save a document in Microsoft Word.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the AutoSum feature in Microsoft Excel?
options: To quickly sum a range of cells
questions.correct: To quickly sum a range of cells
questions.feedback: AutoSum is a feature in Excel that automatically calculates the sum of a range of cells.

questions.question: How do you insert a new slide in Microsoft PowerPoint?
options: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'New Slide'
Click on the 'Home' tab and select 'New Slide'
Right-click on the slide pane and select 'New Slide'
questions.correct: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'New Slide'
questions.feedback: In PowerPoint, you can insert a new slide by selecting the 'New Slide' option from the 'Insert' tab.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Track Changes' feature in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: 'Track Changes' allows multiple users to make edits to a document, and track all modifications.

questions.question: What is the shortcut key to copy a cell in Microsoft Excel?
questions.feedback: Ctrl + C is the shortcut key to copy a selected cell in Excel.

questions.question: How do you insert a table in Microsoft PowerPoint?
options: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Table'
Click on the 'Home' tab and select 'Table'
Right-click on the slide and select 'Table'
questions.correct: Click on the 'Insert' tab and select 'Table'
questions.feedback: In PowerPoint, you can insert a table by selecting 'Table' from the 'Insert' tab.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Spell Check' feature in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: The 'Spell Check' feature in Word automatically identifies and corrects spelling and grammar errors in your document.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Track Changes' feature in Microsoft Word?
questions.feedback: 'Track Changes' is used to track and review edits made to a document, allowing for collaboration.
